title: Furious footy fans accuse sponsor of using Ryan James's Grand Final botch as a 'scapegoat'
text:
Footy fans are fuming after a major sponsor tore up its six-figure contract with the club over Gold Coast Titans star Ryan James blunder at the NRL Grand Final.

James was left red faced when he forgot the words while conducting the Welcome to Country prior to kick-off in front of 80,000 fans and millions of television viewers at a sold-out Sydney's ANZ Stadium on October 6.

James, an Indigenous man, was met with sympathy by the crowd when he announced 'I'm lost' in the middle of the speech.

However, club sponsor hire company TFH was far less sympathetic - tearing up its sponsorship agreement 'effective immediately'.

And fans are not happy, with many calling the company out for using James as a 'scapegoat'.

The Gold Coast Titans have reportedly lost their major sponsor after club captain Ryan James' (pictured with wife Anna) embarrassing blunder at the NRL grand final

'The embarrassing performance of Ryan James in his speech last weekend was offensive and weighed heavily on this decision,' TFH director Brett Thomas wrote in a letter to the team, the Courier Mail reported.

'Additionally, the well documented doubts regarding the club's future in 2020 was also relevantly considered.'

Thomas also cited the performance of the team and coach, along with 'adverse discussions regarding the utilisation and selection of player talent' as reasons for ending its sponsorship, which began in 2012.

Fans took to social media to slam the decision as a 'weak excuse'.

'I find it astonishing that TFH have used #RyanJames as a get out of their contract. It's embarrassing to the company that they would be so weak to pin this on a young man who made a mistake on the biggest stage. Don't worry bra we stand with you,' one person wrote on Twitter.

'To be honest, sounds to me like the sponsor was looking for a way out regardless - just sitting behind the Ryan James stuff up as an excuse . It's s***house to be honest,' wrote another.

Fans took to social media to slam the decision as a 'weak excuse'. 'I find it astonishing that TFH have used #RyanJames as a get out of their contract'

'Boycot TFH events hire. Nasty for them to single out Ryan. He is great and nice to see people are NOT robots. Ryan was not embarrassing but your actions are Playing with someones mental health is unacceptable. You should be ashamed,' another wrote.

A Titans spokesman refused to comment when approached by Daily Mail Australia.

TFH also sponsors the Manly Sea Eagles and the Cronulla Sharks and is associated with many major annual events and music festivals, including the Byron Bay Bluesfest, Splendour in the Grass, the 2018 Commonwealth Games and Melbourne Cup.

The contract termination follows a horror 2019 season for Titans, which finished with its second wooden spoon in the club's 13-year history and sacked coach Garth Brennan midway through the season.

Ryan James (pictured) forgot the words to the Welcome to Country at the NRL Grand Final

Ryan James later called the Welcome to Country as 'the biggest stuff-up of all time.'

James was mocked online since his grand final blunder, where the 28-year-old indigenous star began by thanking the traditional custodians of the land before losing his way midway through the speech.

'As a game we stand together, side by side … I'm lost,' James said.

The crowd laughed and cheered as a red-faced James stood awkwardly grinning at the microphone before Natalie Bassingthwaighte cut him off to sing the national anthem.

James later called the speech as 'the biggest stuff-up of all time.'

Some footy fans have since jumped to Ryan James' defence following the news of the Titans losing a major sponsor over his publicly humiliating grand final gaffe
description: Footy fans are fuming after a major sponsor tore up its six-figure contract with the club over the Gold Coast Titans star Ryan James blunder at the NRL Grand Final.
authors: Kylie Stevens For Daily Mail Australia
